Articles.Content:
Hello! This is the thread for my quality certified (and stock) spacecraft/creations. Included are the Orion CSM, Eagle probe lander, and the Eagle Kerbal carrying lander (so far). If you see Procedural Fairings in the pictures, they are for aesthetics and will not be included in the downloads (though you can certainly add them if you feel like doing so).

DOWNLOADS

Orion CSM: http://www./view/g3phfn8ywv79o0f/Orion%20CSM.craft

Orion CSM Heavy Orange: http://www./view/gw08w3od4yh7ht4/Orion%20CSM%20Heavy%20Orange.craft

Eagle Probe Lander Kerbal Carrying: http://www./view/04355s3u1rtt1t3/Eagle%20Probe%20Lander%20Kerbal%20Carrying%20Stock.craft

Duna Probes (includes the Orion CSM Heavy rocket): http://www./view/21k7amymyh17clh/Eagle%20Probe%20Lander.craft

The parts clipping option is not used for these unless noted (e.g. the Kerbal carrying Eagle lander).

Imgur Album

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Orion CSM

This spacecraft launcher was inspired by the Falcon 9 v1.1, Proton, and the Saturn IB. No parts clipping involved. Capable of low Kerbin orbit. Can be boosted to higher orbits and is capable of Mun or Minmus missions with booster docked to it.

Orion CSM Heavy

This design features the Orion CSM core stage with 2 strap on boosters. The boosters are inspired by the original Falcon 9 design (9 engines arranged in a square pattern). Can be used with the CSM, or you can take the rocket and put probes on top (this design has been used for taking probes to the Duna and Jool systems).

Orion CSM Heavy Orange

A revised asparagus design that is more stable and looks better because of its vibrancy. I was inspired by Temstar to use engine clusters like this because they look cool and have higher ISP than Mainsails.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Eagle Lander Kerbal Carrying

This is a lander designed for use on the Mun or Minmus. Warranty void if used anywhere else. It has enough fuel to land on the moons and enough to reach orbit again. Features science experiments and science instruments. All of the design was made without parts clipping, with the exception being that the Science Bay was clipped into the SAS unite and fuel.

Duna Probe System

This design is launched with the Orion Heavy rocket and carries two landers: one for Duna and the other for Ike. Both were successfully landed on the planet and moon, respectively, with great success! Features science experiments and instruments. Ike version is quite easy too land; the Duna lander is easy to land as well and includes an Atmospheric scanner instrument.

Edited February 1, 2014 by Woopert

Is the fact that there's no replies because I'm not popular, more people check the regular Spacecraft Exchange, or just that people don't have time? It's not a big deal, maybe a mod moving this to the other section might help.

Just curious, it's all good though

This should serve as a bump.

Your crafts look good, keep up the good work.

It does not have to do with the fact that you not popular or that ppl have no time, it's mostly that at this place people go to the topics of their companies and don't watch others work often.

When something is done, they post it on the regular exchange.

You should call friends to join you, or make friends here on the forums that are willing to join a company and recruit.

But if its just a topic to show your work and not to team up, yes post it at the regular space exchange and you will get proper attention.

Amazing craft, amazing asthetics, amazing build. Also just because you're not popular isn't why no ones commenting. I'm the CEO of Arcadia, would you like a partnership. (Don't be hard on yourself, even Arcadia and zokesia are hitting a rough patch, every company isn't getting as many replies as usual, not to toot my horn but Arcadia is a rather large company and zokesia is the biggest and we're hitting rough patches.)

Wow! Just Wow.

These crafts are amazingly done

As I can see it looks as if the launchers can put quite a few tons into orbit.

Right now I'm struggling to get a 2 ton satalite into orbit. So well done.

THanks for the clarification everyone. Nice to get feedback and responses nonetheless. Glad people like them. I've had some sort of resurgence in KSP recently with regards to my design skills, don't know how.

Working on a new launcher that is more vibrant and less wobbly It's almost finished. I took some inspiration from Temstar for the engine clusters.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Finalized, go download if you want/like it!
